# Lecture 8

After learning these fundamental concepts, it's important that we know how to manipulate different types of data as we apply what we know.

In this lesson, we'll fill this blank and go through a detailed review of what strings are and what we can do with them. Strings are how R represents text.

A string is also known as a <b>character vector</b> in R. The word "vector" here is important because it hints at how strings are structured in R.
